title: Midweek corporate retreats and private parties at Bruisyard Hall
text:
Midweek corporate retreats and private parties at Bruisyard Hall Midweek corporate retreats and private parties at Bruisyard Hall Details Category: Venues & Events Created on Friday, 07 August 2015 10:30 Creating camaraderie in an exquisite location is made stress-free at Bruisyard Hall, ranked within the top 100 venues by Conde Nast Traveller and recipient of a 5-star Gold Rating with Visit England. A historic manor set in Suffolk’s countryside near the tranquil village of Saxmundham, Bruisyard Hall offers a prestigious, executive retreat for corporate events, meetings and private parties. 
With over 700 acres of private land, Bruisyard Hall & Barn offer the perfect backdrop for team building, presentations, product launches and incentivised breaks. Excellent transport links to and from London also make Bruisyard Hall easily accessible for busy executives to escape the hustle and bustle of the city in merely 2 hours. Together with event partner EMA Events, each corporate retreat is complemented by a dedicated event manager to ensure expectations are met on a bespoke basis. Guests can be assured of a premium service with facilities for arrival by helicopter, chauffeur driven car or executive transport, country pursuits, superior gourmet options and high-end accommodation. Space to Play Bruisyard Hall’s collection of action-packed activities and country pursuits seek to not only improve interpersonal relations and social interactions but also enhance businesses ability to meet future goals and tasks. From off competitive off-roading to landscape painting, there is something to appeal to everyone, however if there is a specific activity clients have in mind, the Bruisyard Hall team can cater accordingly. The present offering includes two flexible packages: Petrol Heads A great energiser or incentive day activity, businesses will get the opportunity to try their hand at a multitude of new and unique activities, from driving a Land Rover blindfolded or hurtling around a bend in a buggy. Guests can be split into teams and rotate around various activities, with score being kept throughout the day. Expert instructors will provide full briefings with a short demonstration as to how each activity works, before guests attempt themselves. Other adrenaline based activities include: quad biking, power-turns, hovercrafts etc. Bruisyard Hall offers Petrol Heads packages from £130 per person. Final pricing is dependent upon unique requirements and does not include accommodation. Country Pursuits The country pursuits at Bruisyard Hall provide a great break from the bustle of city life and hectic work schedules, with the opportunity to relax and try your hand at a huge range of novel activities. Groups can be divided into teams with points being awarded to create a competitive environment if desired. The offering includes: air rifling, axe throwing, crossbow and clay shooting, falconry, traditional archery and laser clays. Bruisyard Hall offers Country Pursuits packages from £120 per person. Final pricing is dependent upon unique requirements and does not include accommodation. Space to Think The Hall offers a relaxed feel where guests can choose between a fully serviced and catered corporate event or a self-catered package with the option for team bonding over cooking – the facilities cater for both. Corporate retreats can accommodate up to 12 people for single occupancy or up to 24 people when sharing. Bruisyard Barn is also available as off-site accommodation to house additional guests and as further event space. All rooms have been recently refurbished and compliment the history of the hall. Each offer comfortable Vi-Spring beds, White Company amenities, Egyptian cotton linen, towels, towelling bathrobes and stunning countryside views. Gourmet Gourmet experiences at Bruisyard Hall are provided by in-house fine dining caterer, Heathcote and Hare, ensuring guests can be certain not only of exquisite food but exceptional service, attention to detail and an acute awareness of style. In addition to set menus and catering packages, bespoke requests can also be catered for including cooking classes. Behind this incredible offering is Executive Chef David Newstead, who trained at London’s Dorchester Hotel, before going on to work in Germany, Riyadh, Antigua, Moscow and London’s Kensington Marriott.Bruisyard Hall offers exclusive mid-week hire from £1,500 per night and bed & breakfast from just £150 per night. Prices excluding VAT. Related articles
